CatDescriptText: Mr. George Gilbert, politician, St. Clair Village and Mr. Arthur Pollard, student, Bellevue, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 21, 1961, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think students are learning as much under the modern methods of teaching in public schools than students did years ago under the 3 R's (the old teaching method)?" Mr. George Gilbert's answer reads: "The modern methods are better... My youngster is much better off in learning than when I came along."  Mr. Arthur Pollard's answer reads: "It seems that I'm learning more than my father and mother and I have subjects and other learning tools they didn't have."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of George Gilbert wearing fedora, moustache, striped shirt, and tweed jacket, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Arthur Pollard wearing cap, plaid shirt, and dark jacket, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
